<div class="lesson-card">
  <p>Blood cells are a key source of DNA in forensic science, making them crucial for identifying individuals and linking suspects to crime scenes.</p> 

  <p>Blood evidence can also provide information about blood type, patterns, and spatter, which helps investigators reconstruct events and determine how a crime occurred.</p>
